intro: Cleidion spiciflorum var. longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-pedicellate sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related genera. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated leaflets and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. The tree produces hard, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
